item.title: Report E-2025010378
item.description:
Report E-2025010378

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails due to dock operations causing another pallet to puncture the pails resulting in them being damaged. The release impacted the dock floor. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged pails were containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 17th a package was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The package was marked as UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, liquid, n.o.s.(), 9, PGIII. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and will be sent for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025010864
item.description:
Report X-2025010864

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM SPAIN TO PERU WAS COVERED WITH BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THE BLACK COVERING WAS TORN DURING PACKAGE HANDLING REVEALING A CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABEL ON AN INNER BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION WE DISCOVERED THE SHIPMENT CONTAINED TWO INNER BOXES WITH CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABELS, UN3091 LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT AND EMERGENCY CONTACT NUMBER (001) 352-323-3500 THAT HAD BEEN COVERED. TWO CORUS EVO+ GAS VOLUME CONVERTER POWERED WITH LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES WERE CONTAINED IN THE BOXES. THE LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES ARE OVER 2 GRAMS OF EQUIVALENT LITHIUM METAL CONTENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SPAIN USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A24F24, HAM CRIOGENICA SL, 1 PROGRES C, ABRERA SPAIN 18630.
